ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned how to letterpress print, and history of book arts/letterpress in the Western world. Also a great intro to all the special collections at Yale, and met a lot of really interesting guest speakers.

We learned a lot in this course about a variety of topics from the history of calligraphic arts to papermaking. The class was very much an interactive one, learning how to use the letterpress machines to produce ephemeras, broadsides, and books. I found myself enjoying the class a lot with visits to art galleries and getting a hands-on approach to printmaking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A strength was definitely the professor -- Jesse was very knowledgeable, passionate, and always had excellent advice and insight on each project. The TAs were also very available and helpful, and it felt like I had a lot of resources throughout the course.

I do enjoy how hands-on the class was with the projects we were able to get done. However, it did often feel as though there were times when the class felt a little bit rushed, and we had to get our projects done in time. In the beginning, I also wished that there was more guidance on how to operate the machinery and placing in type so that we could be more efficient with our projects, but overall I think that the class did offer a skill of visual thinking and printmaking that I'll be coming back to often.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The hands-on nature of the course was a really good counterbalance for my other academic courses. I really enjoyed spending time in the press, and I enjoyed all the field trips and guest speakers.

I would recommend this course to another student because it is a class that is very much hands-on for those who want to get into printmaking and develop their visual craftsmanship. The class definitely allows you to think deeply about the work you create and provides the freedom to create what you want with the skills and resources you're given. Despite some pocket of moments where you'll have to grind out the work, it was a pleasure to have been in the class.

extras.title: ART 006 01 - Art of the Printed Word
